column4: I hope there is somebody willing to help me in this worst-case senario :(.
you will find out once you've described the scenario.
the menu or Windows keys perhaps?
Xfce uses Alt-F2 as the default shortcut for the xfrun4 program. If that doesn't work, your setup is messed up in more ways than one.
I am sure it is messed up...
can you ssh to the machine from another?
if the keyboard doesn't work at the grub stage, I bet it's USB. Can you connect a PS/2 keyboard temporarily?
have you instructed that person to hold Alt down while they press F2? (Just to be certain...)
is it possible that, on the console, there is a login that just isn't displayed? I'd try a blind login to check.
blind login sounds like a good idea :)
there's no way she could find a mouse somewhere to attach to that machine?
as someone mentioned above, you might be able to get the keyboard to work if you configure USB legacy mode in the BIOS.
I mean, at the grub stage.
keyboard does work at boot time (she could get into the bios), but there is something wrong that grup does not go into the menu
she probably needs to hit Esc once grub takes over from BIOS.
too bad. It looks like you'll have to wait for the shops to open.
